channel.title: Posts on Tech Elixir
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Tech Elixir

item.title: What's up with DuckDBü¶Ü
item.description: I was exploring the vector database world after my day job when I came across ChromaDB which recently raised a seed funding of 20 mils üí∏. Digging deep into chroma led me to DuckDB as these mfs at Chroma are selling a wrapper on an already matured OLAP DB (DuckDB) with hnswlib. Just for context, hnswlib is a C++/Python library for fast calculation of approximate nearest neighbors (ANN). I’ll take more about vector DBs some other day when I’ll hopefully use it in my side project.

item.title: Andrew Ng's Prompt Engineering Courseüßëüèª‚Äçüéì
item.description: I wasted a day of my weekend to take up a course about writing prompt to ChatGPTü§° Now I am writing a blog about what I learnt. I don’t know why I am doing this, I don’t why I completed that course. At this point I don’t even know what I am doing with my life. I need some serious soul-searching. I hope this is just another phase for my charater development and nothing more.

item.title: Why is Redis so Fastü§Ø
item.description: “If I had a dollar for every time a techie suggested Redis to use as cache, I’ll be a millionaire” So what is Redis and why is it so popular among developers?! By definition, Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store. It serves as a fast, versatile, and persistent database, capable of storing various data types like strings, lists, sets, and more. Redis’s speed and simplicity make it an excellent choice for caching, real-time applications, and various use cases requiring rapid data access and manipulation.

item.title: 8 Fallacies of Distributed Computingüö´
item.description: “Mom! I read yet another random research paper that showed up on my Linkedin feed” So I was scrolling through my Linkedin feed when I came across yet another post by a wanna be tech influencer. Although this time the post was much better than those senseless, out-of-context content with an asthetic selfieü§°. The post recommended few interesting papers to read, so I read one of them and here I summarise it.
